intro: Pavetta lasiorhachis, commonly known as the rough-stemmed pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with rough textures on the underside. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Pavetta lasiorhachis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
